text: my name is Hulu Dodie and I'm the chief
information officer and the VP of
technology and data science at Urban
Institute we like to think of ourselves
as truth seekers problem solvers
strategic advisors who believe that we
have the power to really improve public
policy decision-making and practice we
believe in facts and that facts matter
and facts rather than ideology should
shape decisions
what rotas to the cloud was really four
years ago when I first joined urban we
were embarking on a digital
transformation journey one of the major
risks we had was actually security how
you keep everything secured we have
governments and states and local
governments and cities trusting us to be
their source of evidence all our work is
is around data so making sure that this
data is handled in the most transparent
secured way is a top priority we found
the right partnership with the AWS
nonprofit team to really sit with us and
we went through a number of sessions
learned more and then engaged with them
in a roadmap now the team doesn't really
need to spend their time on just kind of
maintaining backups or fighting fires or
etc they don't worry about any of that
now because they're confident that our
environment in the cloud provides a the
top level of
of what we need I think most importantly
it helps accelerate the impact of our
work and accelerate how we apply and
capitalize on advanced technologies to
really transform the way we do research
or policy research and how we do big
data analytics the most important thing
I would say it's brought to us is
opening the door to a quite large set of
potential
